page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: {Kirkcaldy Station}is situated in the centre of the town with easy access to all the amenities. The front entrance leads out to the town's Memorial gardens and the Museum and at the back of the station is a well situated car park with a fine grass and shrub area. The station was{opened in 1847}and trains which ran from Burntisland to Cupar connected with the Edinburgh to Burntisland boat. The station which was{rebuilt in {1960}is very busy, especially on week- day mornings, with commuters and also ,on Saturdays, with shoppers going to Edinburgh. As well as the{passenger service the station also has a{freight depot, loading and unloading such things as seed potatoes from Methil going to Spain.
